plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: An evergreen shrub native to eastern and southern Asia, known for its large, showy flowers that bloom in winter and early spring. The blooms are usually pink, red, or white and appear when many other plants are dormant.
plants.location: East Asia, cultivated worldwide in temperate regions
plants.funFact: Camellia japonica flowers were a favorite of Victorian-era gardeners and are often featured in traditional Japanese gardens.

plants.name: Witch Hazel (Hamamelis virginiana)
plants.description: A deciduous shrub native to North America, known for its fragrant, ribbon-like yellow flowers that bloom in late fall to early winter, often after the leaves have fallen.
plants.funFact: Witch hazel is used in traditional medicine and skincare products for its astringent properties.

plants.name: Helleborus niger
plants.description: A perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe, famous for its white to pink flowers that bloom in late winter, sometimes even pushing through snow.
plants.funFact: Despite its common name, the Christmas rose is not a rose but belongs to the buttercup family and has a long association with Christmas traditions.

plants.name: Protea cynaroides
plants.description: The national flower of South Africa, this striking plant features large, robust flower heads with spiky petals resembling a crown and blooms during the southern hemisphere summer, including December.
plants.funFact: The King Protea is one of the largest protea species and symbolizes change and hope in South African culture.
